title: Talking About Dreams
description: Listen to friends discussing their dreams and imaginary situations.

audio.text:
Mia: Hey Lucas, I've been thinking about a question. If you could do any job in the world, what would you choose?
Lucas: Hmm, that's a tough one. If I could do anything, I think I would be a travel photographer.
Mia: Really? That sounds amazing! Why photography?
Lucas: I love capturing beautiful moments, and if I were a travel photographer, I could see incredible places and share them with the world.
Mia: That's a lovely dream. I would probably be a marine biologist if I could choose any job.
Lucas: Oh, interesting! Are you passionate about the ocean?
Mia: Yes! If I had studied science instead of business, I might be working with dolphins right now.
Lucas: It's not too late, you know. If you really wanted to, you could still study marine biology.
Mia: Maybe. But it would take years, and I'd have to give up my current career.
Lucas: I understand. If I were you, I'd at least look into part-time courses. You never know where it might lead.
Mia: That's good advice. What about money? If you won the lottery tomorrow, what would you do?
Lucas: Oh, that's easy. If I won a lot of money, I would first pay off my parents' house. Then I would travel for a year.
Mia: That's sweet about your parents. I would do something similar.
Lucas: What else would you do?
Mia: If I had unlimited money, I would start a charity for ocean conservation. That way, I could help marine life even without being a biologist.
Lucas: That's brilliant! You could combine your business skills with your passion.
Mia: Exactly! Sometimes I forget that there are different ways to pursue your dreams.
Lucas: You know what? Even if we don't win the lottery, we can still find ways to do what we love.
Mia: You're right. We just have to be creative about it.
